content: the st behind the double_crochet blo single_crochet in next 3 st* repeat from *to* across to last st single_crochet in both loops ch2 fasten_off join color b r8 ch1 single_crochet through both loops of the st * blo single_crochet next 3 st drop drop down double_crochet next st skip the st behind the double_crochet * repeat from *to* across to last st single_crochet in both loops ch2 fasten_off join color a r9 repeat row 5 join color b r10 repeat row 4 join color a r11 repeat row 3 join color b r12 repeat row 6 join color a r13 repeat row 5 join color b r14 repeat row 4 5 www unrulystitch com- instagram @unrulystitch pattern join color a r15 repeat row 7 join color b r16 repeat row 6 join color a r17 repeat row 5 join color b r18 repeat row 6 r19-149 repeat row 3-18 or until you reach your desired length always remember to end with a color a row fasten_off and hide all loose tails though if you are making the double border as i did you can hide those tails there the double border edge with your hook and color a make a slip knot and join in the 2nd st on your last row make sure to be on the looser side when you slip_stitch this will help later when working the second step of the border slip_stitch in each and every st until you reach the last st then you will now work in the side row of your throw picking up a slip_stitch per row until you reach the next corner slip_stitch in each st across the bottom until you reach the next corner and proceed again to pick up 1 slip_stitch per row slip_stitch to the first slip_stitch you made sl st with it and fasten_off turn to the back of your blanket for this next step at the row edge you will want to find the leg on the back side of your blanket of the slip_stitch you made use link if you need help during this part next step of border 6 www unrulystitch com- instagram @unrulystitch pattern you will be working in those legs/st all around your border join your yarn in the first st r1 ch3 counts as double_crochet look for the back of the slip_stitch and make a double_crochet in each one until you reach the first double_crochet you made slip_stitch with the first double_crochet you made r2 ch3 counts as double_crochet *double_crochet in each st until you reach a corner double_crochet ch2 double_crochet in the same st at the corner* repeat from *to* all around slip_stitch with the first double_crochet r3 ch3 counts as double_crochet *double_crochet until you reach the ch2 3dc in the ch2 * repeat *to* around until you reach the first double_crochet slip_stitch with it and fasten_off you will now place your work right side facing you and with your color a yarn join at the slip_stitch picking up the
